sphere_visualizer.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 import rospy
4 import tf
5 from visualization_msgs.msg import Marker
6 
7 
8 def make_marker(is_add, id, xyz, namespace="speheres", rgb=(1.0, 0, 0), radius=0.05):
9  msg = Marker()
10  msg.pose.position.x = xyz[0]
11  msg.pose.position.y = xyz[1]
12  msg.pose.position.z = xyz[2]
13  msg.header.frame_id = "world"
14  msg.type = Marker.SPHERE
15  msg.pose.orientation.x = 0.0
16  msg.pose.orientation.y = 0.0
17  msg.pose.orientation.z = 0.0
18  msg.pose.orientation.w = 1.0
19  msg.header.stamp = rospy.Time()
20  msg.ns = namespace
21  if is_add:
22  msg.action = Marker.ADD
23  else:
24  msg.action = Marker.DELETE
25  msg.id = id
26  msg.scale.x = radius
27  msg.scale.y = radius
28  msg.scale.z = radius
29  msg.color.r = rgb[0]
30  msg.color.g = rgb[1]
31  msg.color.b = rgb[2]
32  msg.color.a = 0.8
33  return msg
34 
35 
36 RADIUS = (0.23, 0.24, 0.2, 0.237, 0.225, 0.20, 0.27, 0.3)
37 
38 rospy.init_node('spheres_visualizer')
39 tf_listener = tf.TransformListener()
40 pub = rospy.Publisher('visualization_marker', Marker, queue_size=100)
41 
42 while not rospy.is_shutdown():
43  for i in range(len(RADIUS)):
44  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
45  try:
46  (trans, rot) = tf_listener.lookupTransform('world', 'control_point{}'.format(i), rospy.Time(0))
47  break
48  except (tf.LookupException,
49  tf.ConnectivityException,
50  tf.ExtrapolationException):
51  continue
52 
53  msg = make_marker(True, i, trans, radius=RADIUS[i])
54  pub.publish(msg)
